chapters.name: ARJUN-VISHAD
chapters.headline: LAMENTING THE CONSEQUENCE OF WAR
chapters.content: In this chapter, the stage is set for the conversation between Lord Krishna & Arjuna in the battlefield of Kurukshetra in about c. 3102 B.C.

chapters.name: SANKHYA-YOG
chapters.headline: THE ETERNAL REALITY OF THE SOULS' IMMORTALITY
chapters.content:
In this chapter, Arjuna accepts the position of a disciple of Lord Krishna and requests him to instruct on how to dispel his grief.
This chapter also summarizes the contents of the Gita.

chapters.name: KARMA-YOG
chapters.headline: THE ETERNAL DUTIES OF HUMAN BEINGS
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna delivers a stern talk to Arjuna about the duties every member of the society needs to carry out.

chapters.name: JNANA-YOG
chapters.headline: APPROACHING THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna reveals how spiritual knowledge can be received and the paths of action and wisdom to be taken.

chapters.name: KARMASANYASAYOG
chapters.headline: ACTION AND RENUNCIATION
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna explains the concepts of action with detachment and renunciation in actions and how both are a means to the same goal of salvation.

chapters.name: ATMASANYAMAYOG
chapters.headline: THE SCIENCE OF SELF-REALIZATION
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna talks about 'astanga yoga,' and how to practice it so one may gain mastery of the mind reveal their spiritual nature.

chapters.name: VIJNANAYOG
chapters.headline: KNOWLEDGE OF THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna tells us about the absolute reality, why it is difficult to overcome Maya and the four types of people that are attracted to and opposed to divinity.

chapters.name: AKSHARAPARABRAHMAYOG
chapters.headline: ATTAINMENT OF SALVATION
chapters.content: In this chapter, Lord Krishna explains the various ways of renouncing the material world, the destination to which each leads to and the rewards they receive.

chapters.name: RAJAVIDYARAJAGUHYAYOG
chapters.headline: CONFIDENTIAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna talks us how the our material existence is created, prevaded, maintained and destroyed by divine powers, the sovereign science and secret.

chapters.name: VIBHUTI YOG
chapters.headline: THE INFINITE GLORIES OF THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna reveals his manifestations as Arjuna prays to him to describe more of his 'opulences' and Krishna explains the most prominent ones.

chapters.name: VISWARUPDARSANAM
chapters.headline: THE VISION OF THE UNIVERSAL FORM
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna grants Arjuna's wish and reveal His universal form - thus showing him His entire existence.

chapters.name: BHAKITYOG
chapters.headline: THE PATH OF DEVOTION
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna extols the glory of true devotion to God and explains the different forms of spiritual disciplines.

chapters.name: KSHETRAKSHETRAJNAVIBHAGAYOGO
chapters.headline: THE INDIVIDUAL AND ULTIMATE CONSCIOUSNESS
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna shows us the difference between the physical body and the immortal soul - the transitory and the perishable vis-a-vis the immutable and the eternal.

chapters.name: GUNATRAYAVIBHAGAYOG
chapters.headline: HE THREE QUALITIES OF MATERIAL NATURE
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna advises Arjuna to relinquish ignorance and passion and how everyone can adopt the path of pure goodness until they acquire the ability to transcend them.

chapters.name: PURUSHOTTAMAPRAPTIYOGO
chapters.headline: REALIZATION OF THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna reveals the transcendental characteristics of the omnipotent, omniscient and omnipresent and explains the purpose and value of knowing and realizing God.

chapters.name: DAIVASARASAUPADWIBHAGAYOG
chapters.headline: THE DIVINE AND THE EVIL NATURES DEFINED
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna explains in detail the divine properties, conduct and actions which are righteous in nature and conducive to divinity while delineating the evil and ill conducts.

chapters.name: SRADDHATRAYAVIBHAGAYOG
chapters.headline: THE THREE TYPES OF MATERIAL EXISTENCE
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krishna tells us about the three divisions of faith and how these different qualities  determine that character of human beings and their consciousness in this world.

chapters.name: MOKSHASANYASAYOG
chapters.headline: ULTIMATE REVELATIONS OF THE SUPREME TRUTH
chapters.content: In this Chapter, Lord Krsishna summarizes the takeaways from the previous chapters and describes the attainment of salvation by the paths of karma and jnana yoga as Arjuna learns to tell nectar from poison and returns to war.
